page.title: 15Sport
page.content: Centre of organised sport is Walkern sports & recreation club built by volunteer labour with funds mainly raised locally. Main users are cricket football, tug of war & clay pigeon shooting clubs. Ardeley also has a successful cricket club which has been in existance for 65yrs but is now at risk as the local riding stable, which owns the land, wants it for grazing their horses. Horse riding is a very popular sport, with farmers & their families & some newcomers who regard it as part of the life of a 'country gentleman'. This also applies to shooting & there is a sydicated pheasant shoot in the area. There is some attempt to encourage comunity participation through the annual inter village sports competition. For other sports eg tennis & swimming people look to Stevenage or further afield.
